courses.description:
üìò ‡πÄ‡∏ô‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏ß‡∏¥‡∏ä‡∏≤‡πÇ‡∏î‡∏¢‡∏•‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏≠‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏î
This course explores the intersection of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) and Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI), with a focus on practical research and real-world applications. Students will gain a foundational understanding of HCI principles and how generative AI technologies‚Äîsuch as large language models, image generators, and conversational agents‚Äîare transforming user interfaces and interactive systems. Through hands-on projects, case studies, and critical analysis, students will investigate how AI can enhance or challenge usability, accessibility, creativity, and user experience. Emphasis will be placed on experimental design, user testing, ethical considerations, and prototyping with generative tools. By the end of the course, students will be able to design, evaluate, and present AI-enhanced interactive systems backed by user-centered research.

This course is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of both linear algebra and quantum computing, with a particular emphasis on their applications in the field of quantum computing. Students will begin by exploring the principles of linear algebra, focusing on its relevance and applications in quantum computing contexts. The course will then delve into the fundamentals of quantum gates and algorithms, ensuring that students gain a solid foundation in these crucial aspects of quantum computing. At the end of the course, students will understand quantum gates and algorithms and be proficient in designing quantum circuits and solving complex quantum computing problems.

courses.description:
üìò ‡πÄ‡∏ô‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏ß‡∏¥‡∏ä‡∏≤‡πÇ‡∏î‡∏¢‡∏•‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏≠‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏î
This course will give an overview of the state of the art in data mining, including an explanation why the unique structure of time series presents difficulties for classic data mining algorithms, and how this structure can potentially be leveraged off. Rather than focusing on the traditional trend analysis and statistics of time series data, this course will focus more on similarity measurement, machine learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques, including cutting edged tools in data mining that can be applied to various problems in time series retrieval as well as in other types of non-time series data.
